did.unittitle: United States Federal Bureau of Investigation files, 1939-1950
did.abstract: These papers concern the investigation into Boas' alleged connections with the Communist party. The continuation of the files beyond the date of Boas' death most likely resulted from similar investigations into the activity of Boas' outspoken son, Ernst Boas.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Requested by Stephen Catlett through Freedom of Information Act, 1983. Received and accessioned, (1985 225ms). See APS Legal File requesting information from FBI.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in: United States Federal Bureau of Investigation.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Franz Boas was an American anthropologist, studied the Eskimos and Northwest Coast Indians, and held positions at Columbia University and the American Museum of Natural History.
